A national leading award winning social care company with an excellent reputation for services for people with complex needs and creating high quality homes in South East England to enable people live full lives is seeking an exceptional and committed Head of Quality to join their team. The Head of Quality will be a integral part of the senior care leadership team therefore you must have a strong track record of transforming services and strong experience in mental health services and will be responsible for the quality assurance across all care services (including people with learning disabilities, physical and mental health needs and acquired brain injury). The Role:


·        Leads on ensuring there is a robust care quality assurance framework, which is embedded, evolves and enables continuous improvement.

·        Develops and monitors the Quality & Continuous Improvement Strategy and associated operational plans across our organisation

·        Develops our framework of joined-up quality monitoring, KPI reporting, and continuous improvement systems whilst recognising the different delivery models across services.

·      ·        Is the organisational ‘lead’ for safeguarding, responsible for the Safeguarding Policy and other associated policies (e.g. MCA / DOLS / LPS)

·        Provides expert advice, guidance and support on all aspects of quality improvement, development and compliance

·        Develops and maintains internal and external networks to increase opportunities to promote co-production and outcome-focused support planning

·        Leads on the development of our evidence based outcome tool and ensure it evolves to best capture people’s aspirations and journeys towards independence and full and aspiring lives.

·        Supports CQC regulatory compliance, evidencing and team coaching

·        Develops new service models in liaison with the Clinical Lead and Director of Care

To provide or assist in wakeful night duty cover in the home
